## Updating openSUSE Tumbleweed
- ***Always*** use `zypper dup` to update Tumbleweed.  Anything else will not move the system to the next rolling release and will most likely cause issues with orphaned packages.
- Tumbleweed is updated when new packages in the Factory repos have passed [openqa testing](https://openqa.opensuse.org).  There are typically multiple updates released per week.
- It is recommended that all Tumbleweed users follow the [Factory mailing list](https://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-factory) for information about new updates.

## Media Codecs
- openSUSE cannot include certain media codecs due to license issues.  See the [Tumbleweed wiki page](https://en.opensuse.org/Portal:Tumbleweed) for instructions on how to install them.

## openSUSE Build Service
- The OBS can be used to find packages not in the default repos, find newer versions of packages, make changes to existing packages, or to create your own packages.
- The [openSUSE software search](https://software.opensuse.org/search) site can be used to find and install packages from the OBS.
- [zow](https://software.opensuse.org/package/zow) can also be used to find and install packages from the OBS.
- `zow` is a wrapper for `zypper` that adds searching for and installing packages from the OBS along with a few other features.
- Repos for packages installed from the OBS with `zow` are added with a lower priority than the default repos to avoid replacing system packages.

[Please read the Tumbleweed wiki page](https://en.opensuse.org/Portal:Tumbleweed)

[Download openSUSE Tumbleweed](https://en.opensuse.org/Portal:Tumbleweed)
